docs.summary:
**Deprecated.**
This code will continue to work, but a newer version is available at
[wix-members-backend.badges](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-members-backend/badges).
description: The Badges API contains functionality for working with [member badges](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-member-badges) from backend code.
> #### Migration Instructions
> If this function is already in your code, it will continue to work.
> To stay compatible with future changes, migrate to
> [`wix-members-backend.badges`](wix-members-backend/badges).
> To migrate to the new function:
> 1. Add the new import statement:
>    ```javascript
>    import { badges } from 'wix-members-backend'
> 2. If you plan to migrate all functions that use `badges`,
>    remove the original `import { badges } from 'wix-users-backend'` statement.
> 3. Look for any code that uses `badges`.
>    Update your code to work with the new `badges`
>    call and response properties.
> 4. Test your changes to make sure your code behaves as expected.
To use the Badges API, import `{ badges }` from the `wix-users-backend` module:
```javascript
import { badges } from 'wix-users-backend';

params.name: badgeId
params.doc: The ID of the badge to assign members to.

params.name: memberIds
params.doc: The IDs of the members to assign to the badge.

ret.doc:
Fulfilled - The IDs of the members assigned to the badge.
Rejected - Error message.

docs.summary:
**Deprecated.**
This function will continue to work, but a newer version is available at
[wix-members-backend.badges.assignMembers()](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-members-backend/badges/assignmembers).
description: Assigns a badge to site members.
> #### Migration Instructions
> If this function is already in your code, it will continue to work.
> To stay compatible with future changes, migrate to
> [`wix-members-backend.badges.assignMembers()`](wix-members-backend/badges/assignmembers).
> To migrate to the new function:
> 1. Add the new import statement:
>    ```javascript
>    import { badges } from 'wix-members-backend'
> 2. Remove the original `import { badges } from 'wix-users-backend'` statement.
> 3. Test your changes to make sure your code behaves as expected.
The `assignMembers()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the
members with the given IDs are assigned as badge holders of the specified badge.
The `badgeId` parameter must be an ID from your site's `Members/Badges` collection.
Typically, you retrieve the ID from from the collection using a query or through a dataset.

examples.title: Assign a badge to members
body: // NOTE: This example uses the new wix-members-backend.badges.assignMembers()
//       See the function description for more information, and
// NOTE: This example uses the deprecated

examples.title: Assign a badge to forum members with a top post
body: // NOTE: This example uses the new wix-members-backend.badges.assignMembers()
//       See the function description for more information, and
// Get the "Top Poster" badge ID from the Members/Badges collection
// Must be placed in an async function
// Assign post owner IDs to the topPostOwners array
// NOTE: This example uses the deprecated
// "Top Poster" badge ID from the Members/Badges collection

extra.description: In this example, we query the Forum/Posts collection for all posts with a Like Count greater than 50. We store the member IDs of the post owners in an array, and assign those members a "Top Poster" badge.

params.name: badgeInfo
params.doc: The information to use when creating the badge.

ret.doc:
Fulfilled - The newly created badge.
Rejected - Error message.

docs.summary:
**Deprecated.**
This function will continue to work, but a newer version is available at
[wix-members-backend.badges.createBadge()](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-members-backend/badges/createBadge).
description: Creates a badge.
> #### Migration Instructions
> If this function is already in your code, it will continue to work.
> To stay compatible with future changes, migrate to
> [`wix-members-backend.badges.createBadge()`](wix-members-backend/badges/createBadge).
> To migrate to the new function:
> 1. Add the new import statement:
>    ```javascript
>    import { badges } from 'wix-members-backend'
> 2. Remove the original `import { badges } from 'wix-users-backend'` statement.
> 3. Test your changes to make sure your code behaves as expected.
The `createBadge()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the newly created badge when
the badge is created.
Badges created with the `createBadge()` function will not have any badge permissions. You
can [set badge permissions](https://support.wix.com/en/article/setting-permissions-for-a-member-badge) in the Site Members area of your dashboard.
If `backgroundColor` and `textColor` are not specified they will default to `#796EFF` (purple) and `#FFFFFF` (white) respectively.

description: Deletes a badge.
> #### Migration Instructions
> If this function is already in your code, it will continue to work.
> To stay compatible with future changes, migrate to
> [`wix-members-backend.badges.deleteBadge()`](wix-members-backend/badges/deleteBadge).
> To migrate to the new function:
> 1. Add the new import statement:
>    ```javascript
>    import { badges } from 'wix-members-backend'
> 2. Remove the original `import { badges } from 'wix-users-backend'` statement.
> 3. Test your changes to make sure your code behaves as expected.
The `deleteBadge()` function returns a Promise that resolves when
the badge with the specified ID has been deleted.
The `badgeId` parameter must be an ID from your site's `Members/Badges` collection.
Typically, you retrieve the ID from from the collection using a query or through a dataset.

> To stay compatible with future changes, migrate to
> [`wix-members-backend.badges.listMemberBadges()`](wix-members-backend/badges/listMemberBadges).
> To migrate to the new function:
> 1. Add the new import statement:
>    ```javascript
>    import { badges } from 'wix-members-backend'
> 2. Remove the original `import { badges } from 'wix-users-backend'` statement.
> 3. Test your changes to make sure your code behaves as expected.
The `listMemberBadges()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a
list of badge IDs associated with each of the specified members.

> 3. Test your changes to make sure your code behaves as expected.
The `removeMembers()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the
members with the given IDs are removed as badge holders of the specified badge.

docs.summary:
**Deprecated.**
This function will continue to work, but a newer version is available at
[wix-members-backend.badges.updateBadge()](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-members-backend/badges/updateBadge).
description: Updates a badge.
> #### Migration Instructions
> If this function is already in your code, it will continue to work.
> To stay compatible with future changes, migrate to
> [`wix-members-backend.badges.updateBadge()`](wix-members-backend/badges/updateBadge).
> To migrate to the new function:
> 1. Add the new import statement:
>    ```javascript
>    import { badges } from 'wix-members-backend'
> 2. Remove the original `import { badges } from 'wix-users-backend'` statement.
> 3. Test your changes to make sure your code behaves as expected.
The `updateBadge()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the updated badge when
the badge with the specified ID has been updated.
Only the properties passed in the `BadgeInfo` object will be updated. All other properties will remain the same.
Since the badge's `slug` is based on the badge's `title`, if you change the badge `title`, the badge `slug` will update accordingly.
The `badgeId` parameter must be an ID from your site's `Members/Badges` collection.
Typically, you retrieve the ID from from the collection using a query or through a dataset.

examples.title: Update an existing badge
body: // NOTE: This example uses the new wix-members-backend.badges.updateBadge()
//       See the function description for more information, and
description: "Contributed 5... wait, no... 10 posts this month!",
// NOTE: This example uses the deprecated

docs.summary: An object representing a member badge.

members.name: backgroundColor
members.doc: Background color of the badge as a hexadecimal rgb color value. The default color is `#796EFF` (purple).

members.name: textColor
members.doc: Text color of the badge as a hexadecimal rgb color value. The default color is `#FFFFFF` (white).

members.name: icon
members.doc:
Badge icon as an SVG image. One of the following:

  + An external web URL in the following format: `http(s)://<image url>`.
  + The [source URL](wix-media-backend.mediaManager.html#getFileUrl) for a Wix Media Manager file. Wix Media Manager file names in a `wix:image://...` format are not supported.

members.name: roleId
members.doc: ID of the role that badge members are assigned to.

members.name: slug
members.doc: Badge's unique URL as used in a dynamic page.

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the badge was created.

members.name: updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the badge was last updated.

docs.summary: Information to use when creating or updating a badge.

members.name: backgroundColor
members.doc: Background color of the badge as a hexadecimal rgb color value. The default color is `#796EFF` (purple).

members.name: textColor
members.doc: Text color of the badge as a hexadecimal rgb color value. The default color is `#FFFFFF` (white).

members.name: icon
members.doc:
Badge icon as an SVG image. One of the following:

  + An external web URL in the following format: `http(s)://<image url>`.
  + The [source URL](wix-media-backend.mediaManager.html#getFileUrl) for a Wix Media Manager file. Wix Media Manager file names in a `wix:image://...` format are not supported.

docs.summary: An object representing the badges associated with a member.

members.name: badgeIds
members.doc: IDs of all badges assigned to the specified member.
